abstract: Mark Hurd, Hewlett-Packard’s chairman and C.E.O., says that focusing on strategy and staff were key to helping the company recover from last year’s spying scandal.
snippet: Mark Hurd, Hewlett-Packard’s chairman and C.E.O., says that focusing on strategy and staff were key to helping the company recover from last year’s spying scandal.
lead_paragraph: Mark Hurd, Hewlett-Packard’s chairman and chief executive, has rebuilt the company’s board after revelations last year of spying operations conducted against several directors and journalists.

headline.main: Seeing Recruiting as Crucial to Rebuilding H.P.
